titleproper.value: Guide to the Joanne Landy Papers  <num>TAM.785</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2020-01-22T19:04:46</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

extent.value: in 5 manuscript boxes, 1 half manuscript box, and 1 oversize folder.

abstract.value: This collection consists of correspondence, flyers, and administrative files related to socialist activist Joanne Landy's work as an editor for <emph render="italic">New Politics</emph> magazine and as an organizer for the Campaign for Peace and Democracy. The materials cover the editorial and administrative processes involved in publishing <emph render="italic">New Politics</emph> during the 1980s through the early 2000s and the social and intellectual context of the advocacy Landy organized with the Campaign for Peace and Democracy. The files are both paper and electronic, though the majority of the records are paper. The files on the Campaign for Peace and Democracy include audio and video recordings of talks by Landy pertaining to the organization's activism.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Joanne Landy Papers; TAM 785; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Tom Harrison in January 2019, the accession number associated with this donation is 2019.049.

Joanne Landy (1941-2017) was a writer, editor, and activist associated with the "Third Camp" socialist movement, who critiqued authoritarianism in nations on both sides of the Cold War. A student activist in the 1960s, Landy went on to be a longstanding member of the editorial board for the socialist magazine <emph render="italic">New Politics</emph>. In 1982, she co-founded the Campaign for Peace and Democracy, an international leftist solidarity movement advocating for egalitarian democratic socialism.

This collection consists of activist and writer Joanne Landy's files on her editorial work at <emph render="italic">New Politics</emph> magazine and her activist work as co-director of the Campaign for Peace and Democracy. The files on <emph render="italic">New Politics</emph> reflect Landy's  work on the magazine's editorial board in the 1980s through the 2000s, including correspondence with subscribers, writers, and other members of the editorial board, alongside meeting minutes and other administrative records pertaining to the magazine. The files on the Campaign for Peace and Democracy include flyers for events and protests, clippings, correspondence, electronic records, audio recordings, and video recordings related to the organization's progressive anti-war international activism starting from the 1980s until Landy's death in 2017.

dsc.value:
Series I: New Politics Correspondences and Administrative Records1967-2000Scope and Contents

Series I contains correspondences and various administrative records of the New Politics publication, including editorial board minutes and copyright certificates.

Series II contains documents pertaining to the Campaign for Peace and Democracy. The series consists mostly of flyers, clippings, and ephemera from events and actions. Series also contains audiocassettes and digital files.
